benchmark_details.name: EngiBench (Engineering Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: EngiBench is a hierarchical benchmark designed to evaluate large language models on solving engineering problems, spanning three levels of increasing difficulty and covering diverse engineering subfields.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To systematically evaluate large language models on real-world engineering problem-solving capabilities.

data.source: Problems were sourced from existing public benchmarks, educational materials, and modeling competitions.
data.annotation: Annotated by a mix of PhD students and engineering professionals with assistance from LLMs.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on comparisons to ground truth answers and expert rubrics.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores reflect better performance in reasoning and problem-solving capabilities.
methodology.baseline_results: Human experts achieved an average score of 8.58 on open-ended tasks.
methodology.validation: Inter-annotator agreement ensured the consistency of evaluation.
